Specimen Type: Serum, plasma, whole blood, urine, cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), or other body fluids
Purpose: To provide a standardized procedure for analyzing miscellaneous tests and ensure accurate, reliable results for specimens that do not fall into conventional categories.
Container: Appropriate collection container or tube specified by the individual test (e.g., serum or plasma tube, urine cup, sterile CSF tube).
Equipment: Centrifuges, pipettes, and designated analyzers for each specific test
